content:
• Friday, June 21, 2013
  • GOGO

    Shares of Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) finish lower in a lackluster debut, closing at $16, after being...

    Shares of Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) finish lower in a lackluster debut, closing at $16, after being priced at $17 - the high end of its range. Blame it on poor timing, because the FAA poured gas on the stock this morning and it still failed to light. The agency is expected to relax current rulings that certain electronic devices be powered down during taxiing, take-off and landing. GOGO is the main in-flight provider of Wifi in the U.S. and uses air-to-ground cellular towers to connect flying aircraft to the Internet.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM

    Shares of Fibrocell Science (NASDAQ:FCSC) rise 4% AH following a dramatic 14.8% decline in the final nine minutes of trading.

  • AUMN

    Golden Minerals (NYSEMKT:AUMN) -7.8% AH after announcing it is suspending operations at its...

    Golden Minerals (NYSEMKT:AUMN) -7.8% AH after announcing it is suspending operations at its Velardena mine to conserve the asset until operating plans and prices for silver and gold indicate a sustainable cash margin for operations. AUMN estimates ~$7M in related charges in Q2 and Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • STS

    Supreme Industries (STS -2.7%) says it's reached an agreement with King County, Washington,...

    Supreme Industries (STS -2.7%) says it's reached an agreement with King County, Washington, settling an alleged breech of contract regarding a fleet of buses. The company has agreed to pay more than $4.7M to settle the suit.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • EBIX

    With its shares cratering thanks to the Goldman deal termination and fears of serious accounting...

    With its shares cratering thanks to the Goldman deal termination and fears of serious accounting misdeeds, Ebix (EBIX -12.5%) tries to stem the bleeding by announcing a $100M buyback it plans to complete in the next 24 months. The insurance software firm says the buybacks will be funded via cash on hand (currently stands at $35.5M) and future cash flows (exc. acquisitions, 2012 free cash flow was $65.3M). Based on today's close, the buyback would be good for repurchasing 28% of outstanding shares. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    Salesforce's (CRM +4.2%) partnership with Oracle (ORCL -9.2%) will include a deal to allow the...

    Salesforce's (CRM +4.2%) partnership with Oracle (ORCL -9.2%) will include a deal to allow the companies' apps to "easily share data," the NYT reports. Though the deal may have been sparked by frustrated customers demanding interoperability between Salesforce's CRM cloud apps (esp. Sales Cloud) and Oracle's CRM, ERP, and HR apps, it nonetheless represents a thawing of occasionally frosty ties between the rivals. No word on whether Oracle will reach a similar deal with cloud ERP/HR software rival Workday (WDAY +0.7%), whom Larry Ellison took multiple shots at during the FQ4 call.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • JAZZ

    Brean Capital raises its price target on Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +2.5%) to $93 from $88....

    Brean Capital raises its price target on Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +2.5%) to $93 from $88. Analyst Gene Mack says FY13 EPS and revenue should come in at $6.25 and $870M respectively, above consensus of $6.21/share on $851.43M in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy Group (REGI +2.7%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and a $17 price...

    Renewable Energy Group (REGI +2.7%) is initiated with an Outperform rating and a $17 price target at Wedbush, saying the biodiesel producer is expanding to better handle increasing demand, which puts it in a better position for strong earnings growth. The firm also sees REGI looking for potential deals to help diversify its geographic footprint and product offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • ESI-OLD

    Shares of ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD -7.5%) take a beating after Argus downgrades the...

    Shares of ITT Educational Services (ESI-OLD -7.5%) take a beating after Argus downgrades the stock to Sell citing negative enrollment trends, "reduced government funding for Pell grants, [and] relatively high tuition rates." The firm also points to below-peer group EPS and revenue growth rates. Across the sector: LINC -2.3%, LOPE -1.17%, APOL -2.94%, STRA -2.23%, EDMC -9.45%, COCO -0.93%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (OSIS +13.6%) says it reached a favorable resolution and entered into an...

    OSI Systems (OSIS +13.6%) says it reached a favorable resolution and entered into an administrative agreement with the Department of Homeland Security settling issues relating to its Rapiscan Secure 1000SP Advanced Imaging Technology system and associated Automated Target Recognition software. In summary, Rapiscan can continue its current and future business with U.S. government agencies.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIDU

    Already fierce rivals, Baidu (BIDU -0.1%) and Qihoo (QIHU -4.8%) appear set to compete even...

    Already fierce rivals, Baidu (BIDU -0.1%) and Qihoo (QIHU -4.8%) appear set to compete even more. Marbridge Consulting observes Baidu has released a beta version of a PC security/maintenance app called Baidu Guard, which would compete against Qihoo's very popular 360 Safeguard software. The release comes a few months after Baidu unveiled antivirus software that also competes against Safeguard. Qihoo, which often bundles its browser and security software, claimed 457M monthly users for all its products/services as of March. Mobile security software users totaled 275M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • AGN

    Adding to Allergan's (AGN -4.3%) weakness today is a new FDA document which discusses generic...

    Adding to Allergan's (AGN -4.3%) weakness today is a new FDA document which discusses generic Restasis, a generic cyclosporine ophthalmic emulsion, suggesting that conducting a BE study with clinical endpoint doesn't appear feasible or reliable due to the modest efficacy demonstrated by the Reference Listed Drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • EQC

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH +4.7%) gets a charge as Corvex and Related say more than 70% of...

    CommonWealth REIT (CWH +4.7%) gets a charge as Corvex and Related say more than 70% of stockholders have approved removing the entire board, effective immediately. "As of today Barry Portnoy, Adam Portnoy (and the rest of the board) are in our view no longer trustees and have no authority to act as such." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • ELP

    Shares of Brazilian state-owned power utility Companhia Paranaense de Energia (ELP -15.3%)...

    Shares of Brazilian state-owned power utility Companhia Paranaense de Energia (ELP -15.3%) plunge after energy sector watchdog Aneel yesterday cleared a 14.61% average tariff increase for Copel's distribution unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • RXN

    Rexnord (RXN +7.8%) reverses earlier losses to trade higher after the company priced its...

    Rexnord (RXN +7.8%) reverses earlier losses to trade higher after the company priced its previously announced 6.5M share public offering at $16, only a slight discount to yesterday's close. The company also granted the underwriters an option to purchase up to an additional 975K if needed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI -4.6%) reverses yesterday's post session loss to trade...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI -4.6%) reverses yesterday's post session loss to trade higher, after it said late Thursday that it had conducted a strategic review of its business and decided to pursue the development of its materials science platform, which is sees as the most likely path to enhance growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • MUFG

    Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MTU +1%) is set to buy a 51% stake in Thailand's Bank of Ayudhya...

    Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MTU +1%) is set to buy a 51% stake in Thailand's Bank of Ayudhya (OTCPK:BKAHF), in what could be the largest acquisition by a Japanese bank in Southeast Asia. The stake, which includes GE's (GE +1%) Capital's entire 25% position in the company, could be worth over $4B when completed. A deal could be announced as early as next week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • PGRX

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -67.8%) plunges after this morning's announcement of a...

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -67.8%) plunges after this morning's announcement of a public offering of ~41.6M units at $0.12 each. The financing is intended to support continued development of PGRX's Holbrook Basin Project.

  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +8%) pops today after Caxton's Bruce Kovner discloses another...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +8%) pops today after Caxton's Bruce Kovner discloses another purchase. Kovner, who is also a board member, bought 200K shares during Wednesday's session through a family trust at an average price of $3.9958. The purchase increases his overall stake to over 22.7M shares and follows a deal earlier this month where he acquired 2M shares at $4.65 apiece.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • WHR

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -5.1%) and Select Comfort (SCSS -2.9%) trade weak on what some analysts...

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -5.1%) and Select Comfort (SCSS -2.9%) trade weak on what some analysts are calling a delayed reaction to weakness in the homebuilding sector. The pair are also acting as a bit of a drag for the Homebuilders ETF (XHB -2.8%) of which they are a holding.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +1.5%) bucks a weak overall tape to trade higher today, after...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +1.5%) bucks a weak overall tape to trade higher today, after announcing the appointment of Jack Callicutt as its chief financial officer, effective July 1.

  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN -2.8%) dips on a Goldman downgrade to Neutral this morning. The firm cites a lack...

    Allergan (AGN -2.8%) dips on a Goldman downgrade to Neutral this morning. The firm cites a lack of near-term catalysts, saying it now sees greater upside to Forest Labs (NYSE:FRX), with its potential for significant restructuring/strategic alternatives and pending new management changes later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -15.6%) tanks after SA contributor Alpha Exposure declares the company is...

    UniPixel (UNXL -15.6%) tanks after SA contributor Alpha Exposure declares the company is "probably under investigation by the SEC," after the agency rejected a Freedom of Information Act request from the author for its correspondences with UniPixel by citing an exemption protecting it from disclosing records whose release "could reasonably be expected to interfere with enforcement activities." Alpha Exposure adds it has complained to the SEC in the past about perceived securities violations by UniPixel, and that the track records of UniPixel's CEO, CTO, CFO, and former CEO suggest the company is "run by an untrustworthy management team."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 8 Comments
  • WFC

    A check of the TBTFs finds Wells Fargo (WFC +0.9%) the only gainer amidst a floated report the...

    A check of the TBTFs finds Wells Fargo (WFC +0.9%) the only gainer amidst a floated report the Fed and FDIC are weighing a doubling in the "simple leverage ratio." Wells already exceeds the 6% proposed ratio, but presumably BofA (BAC -2.8%), JPMorgan (JPM -1.3%), Citigroup (C -4%), Goldman (GS -1.7%), and Morgan Stanley (MS -3.1%) would need to halt or pare back dividends and buybacks should the rule be implemented. The financial SPDR (XLF -1.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 8 Comments
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -5.3%) slips a little harder than the overall market this morning...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -5.3%) slips a little harder than the overall market this morning after being downgraded by Bank of America to a Neutral. The firm says that the ROI for Synacthen looks challenging due to lack of intellectual property, uncertain clinical data, and no ex-US commercial/regulatory infrastructure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 9 Comments
  • ORCL

    As was the case in March, cloud competition is in focus as Oracle (ORCL -8.6%) dives following a...

    As was the case in March, cloud competition is in focus as Oracle (ORCL -8.6%) dives following a revenue/EPS miss marked by soft new license/cloud subscription growth. "Seasonally, the fourth quarter is their biggest ... software quarter and we have a miss here on software," observes Edward Jones' Josh Olson. Goldman's Heather Bellini is defending Oracle, arguing the shortfall is "likely more macro driven than company-specific." Rivals SAP (SAP -3.3%), VMware (VMW -3.2%), and Citrix (CTXS -2.1%) are underperforming. Larry Ellison mentioned on the earnings call Oracle plans to launch an in-memory version of its 12c database to take on SAP's Hana; Oracle has thus far taken a hardware-centric approach to competing with Hana.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -13%) shrugs off earlier news of orders to trade lower after selling...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -13%) shrugs off earlier news of orders to trade lower after selling 428,398 shares of its common stock at $4.50 apiece, a hefty 16% discount to yesterday's, close. The sale generates $1.9M in net proceeds, which the company plans to use for working capital and other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • MGLN

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN -3.6%) says it's withdrawing from Fallon Total Care, its...

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN -3.6%) says it's withdrawing from Fallon Total Care, its previously announced joint venture with Fallon Community Health Plan. MGLN saying the approved Medicare & Medicaid rates under the demonstration program in Massachusetts were not adequate to fund the expected health care costs. MGLN's 49% interest in the FTC Joint Venture will be transfered to Fallon, and won't have a material effect on guidance for 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -14.5%) dives below $10 after SA contributor Gotham City Research takes fresh aim in...

    Ebix (EBIX -14.5%) dives below $10 after SA contributor Gotham City Research takes fresh aim in the wake of the Goldman deal termination, arguing shares are worth $8 at most and "likely headed to $0." Gotham points out Ebix has a negative net cash position, thinks it could owe $100M+ in back-taxes/penalties/interest, sees its numerous investigations as a major distraction for management, and believes a criminal indictment is possible. (Feb. 21 report)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 4 Comments
  • GOGO

    Gogo's (NASDAQ:GOGO) IPO isn't going well. After pricing its 11M-share offering at $17 (the high...

    Gogo's (NASDAQ:GOGO) IPO isn't going well. After pricing its 11M-share offering at $17 (the high end of a $15-$17 range), shares opened at $16 and are currently at $16.47, down 3.1%. That gives the provider of in-flight Wi-Fi services a valuation of $1.41B, or 6.1x 2012 sales. (S-1) (Q1 results/stats)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • STML

    Aegis Capital sees good things in Stemline Therapeutics' (STML +1.8%) future, noting that the...

    Aegis Capital sees good things in Stemline Therapeutics' (STML +1.8%) future, noting that the company "appears to be exceptionally well-funded [and] should continue to attract interest based on the accelerated development pathway for its lead drug candidate, SL-401 " (I, II, III). The shares are reiterated at Buy and the price target is raised to $40 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • MCK

    McKesson Corp (MCK +1%) names Nigel Rees, its vice president and controller, to the finance...

    McKesson Corp (MCK +1%) names Nigel Rees, its vice president and controller, to the finance chief position on an interim basis until a permanent replacement is hired. Current CFO Jeff Campbell is stepping down at the end of the month to become CFO at American Express after nearly a decade in the position with MCK.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • AMD

    Jim Cramer gave AMD (AMD +1.6%) and Micron (MU +1.7%) favorable mentions during last night's...

    Jim Cramer gave AMD (AMD +1.6%) and Micron (MU +1.7%) favorable mentions during last night's airing of Mad Money, and the chipmakers seem to be moving higher in response. Though not a fan of AMD's losses and debt, Cramer is bullish on account of the company's Xbox One/PS4 design wins, and thinks shares are likely to get upgraded. Regarding Micron, Cramer points out the company is benefiting from improving demand and less competition - a few investors already seem to have figured that out. (Micron FQ1: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (JKS +2.6%) rallies after announcing a deal to supply 25.8MW of solar modules for...

    JinkoSolar (JKS +2.6%) rallies after announcing a deal to supply 25.8MW of solar modules for India's first private solar park. Indian solar installation activity has been growing quickly, but is still much less than China's. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • ARNA

    Adam Feuerstein via Twitter on Arena's (ARNA +4.9%) Belviq: "Belviq TRx for week of 6/14 (per...

    Adam Feuerstein via Twitter on Arena's (ARNA +4.9%) Belviq: "Belviq TRx for week of 6/14 (per IMS) are 1,087."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 5 Comments
  • BEP

    Brookfield Renewable Energy Partners (BEP +3.6%) moves higher after announcing last night that,...

    Brookfield Renewable Energy Partners (BEP +3.6%) moves higher after announcing last night that, due to current capital market conditions, it will not proceed with its previously announced U.S. and Canadian public offering of limited partnership units.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • NTGR

    NetGear's (NTGR +2.7%) bad news is priced in and its hardware sales will benefit from the...

    NetGear's (NTGR +2.7%) bad news is priced in and its hardware sales will benefit from the adoption of the new 802.11ac Wi-Fi standard, argues Wedbush's Rohit Chopra, who's upgrading shares to Outperform. Chopra also sees the expected launch of 802.11ac-capable iPhones and iPads giving NetGear a boost. Shares still -17% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • ZNGA

    A downgrade to Underperform from one-time lead underwriter Morgan Stanley leads Zynga (ZNGA...

    A downgrade to Underperform from one-time lead underwriter Morgan Stanley leads Zynga (ZNGA -2.6%) to open lower. Analyst Scott Devitt believes Zynga's mobile transition will be longer and harder than expected, thinks Zynga might not benefit from real-money gambling until 2014 or 2015, and wouldn't be surprised to see more job cuts. His PT goes to $2.60 from $3.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 10 Comments
  • ORMP

    Oramed (ORMP +16.2%) soars after saying "market conditions" have caused it to withdraw a...

    Oramed (ORMP +16.2%) soars after saying "market conditions" have caused it to withdraw a proposed public offering. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • PMC

    PharMerica (PMC -9.2%) slides after saying Kindred Healthcare (KND -1.6%) will not renew a...

    PharMerica (PMC -9.2%) slides after saying Kindred Healthcare (KND -1.6%) will not renew a skilled nursing pharmacy services contract when it expires in December. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) +3.1% following an upgrade to Outperform from Cowen; the firm's PT is...

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) +3.1% following an upgrade to Outperform from Cowen; the firm's PT is unchanged at $46. Shares closed yesterday barely a dollar above their 52-week low of $33.91. Fidelity has confirmed it's now a Rackspace OpenStack client (previous); it's initially using OpenStack to build a private cloud, but wants to eventually create a hybrid cloud.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • SPRD

    Premarket gainers: SPRD +22%. NVGN +12%. KMX +8%. THRX +7%. MTL +7%. Losers: IDIX -35%. ORCL...

    Premarket gainers: SPRD +22%. NVGN +12%. KMX +8%. THRX +7%. MTL +7%.
    Losers: IDIX -35%. ORCL -8%. AHT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM

  • Indonesian (EIDO, IDX) and Philippine (EPHE) shares have another tough day, falling 2.48% and...

    Indonesian (EIDO, IDX) and Philippine (EPHE) shares have another tough day, falling 2.48% and 2.28% respectively. Markets were stable for the most part across the rest of the region as Malaysian (EWM), Thai (THD), and Vietnamese (VNM) stocks escape with minimal losses. The Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) sheds 0.28% in Singapore.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM

  • Sizable pre-open gains in stock index futures melt away with the crumbling of Greece's ruling...

    Sizable pre-open gains in stock index futures melt away with the crumbling of Greece's ruling coalition as good of an excuse as any for selling. Just like the old days: The euro (FXE) quickly slips about 70 pips and the Stoxx 50 (FEZ) drops 1%, now flat on the session. S&P 500 (SPY) futures +0.25%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) are up 2.4% premarket after the automaker demos its battery...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) are up 2.4% premarket after the automaker demos its battery swap plans for drivers who want to be back on the road in under two minutes. Though the concept falls in line with Tesla's reputation of thinking outside the box, it also raises a few questions on costs and the impact of degraded batteries.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM | 30 Comments
  • IDIX

    It's likely to be a rough day for Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) after yesterday's...

    It's likely to be a rough day for Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) after yesterday's announcement regarding IDX20963. The shares are off 33% premarket and the downgrades are coming in fast. JPMorgan, JMP, and Deutsche Bank have all cut the shares and Baird has started the stock at Underperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • AHT

    Ashford Hospitality Trust (AHT) prices its 11M share secondary at $12 each, with proceeds set to...

    Ashford Hospitality Trust (NYSE:AHT) prices its 11M share secondary at $12 each, with proceeds set to fund the spinoff of Ashford Hospitality Prime. An ill-timed offering - AHT shares fell 8.5% yesterday and are off another 3.8% premarket to $11.97. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • FRX

    Goldman upgrades Forest Laboratories (NYSE:FRX) to Buy from Neutral (price target to $50 from...

    Goldman upgrades Forest Laboratories (NYSE:FRX) to Buy from Neutral (price target to $50 from $40). Analyst Jami Rubin's view of the company has "evolved" and the firm now believes a "more aggressive" allocation of capital and share repurchases could be in the cards. Shares +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • KMX

    More on CarMax's (NYSE:KMX) FQ1: Used unit sales at comparable stores rose 17% to mark the...

    More on CarMax's (NYSE:KMX) FQ1: Used unit sales at comparable stores rose 17% to mark the company's best gain in several years. The company says improvements in execution at its store contributed to the strong quarter as well as a more favorable consumer credit atmosphere. New vehicle sales dropped 5.5% while wholesales vehicle sale rose 4.9%. KMX +1.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:48 AM
  • FIVE

    Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) announces it will postpone a secondary offering of common shares it had...

    Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) announces it will postpone a secondary offering of common shares it had scheduled. Earlier this week, the announcement of the 8.6M share offering caused shares to crumple. FIVE +4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says it has assessed a fixed-dose combination of Vascepa and rosuvastatin...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says it has assessed a fixed-dose combination of Vascepa and rosuvastatin (versus the administration of the individual agents) and the results are "promising" given that "there was no inhibition of either the rosuvastatin bioavailability, or of the bioavailability of the active metabolite EPA from Vascepa." The test formulation was well tolerated and there were no serious adverse events reported. Shares +5.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is upgraded to Buy with $30 price target and a $36 "upside scenario" at UBS...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is upgraded to Buy with $30 price target and a $36 "upside scenario" at UBS which says new monetization efforts could force the Street to revise estimates higher. Shares +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD) announces receipt of a non-binding $28.50/share cash...

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD) announces receipt of a non-binding $28.50/share cash acquisition offer from Tsinghua Holdings. Shares +7.6% premarket to $23.98. Kudos to SA Pro's Ashraf Eassa who just two weeks ago - with the stock under $20 - said he saw 55% upside in the shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • BZF

    Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff has called an emergency cabinet meeting for today after two...

    Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff has called an emergency cabinet meeting for today after two weeks of demonstrations yesterday culminated in over 1.25M people marching in more than 100 cities. The protesters are angry about a range of economic issues, including the huge sums spent on the Soccer World Cup next year, the rising cost of living and the poor quality of public services. Over the past five day, the real (NYSEARCA:BZF) has dropped 5.2% vs the dollar while the Bovespa is -4.6%.

    Like equities, mostly, oil (NYSEARCA:USO) is also making a bit of a comeback after the great global rout yesterday, with futures +0.5%. The Fed's tapering pledge and rising output may be downside factors, but there's also Syria and Iran to remember. "The geopolitical premium must not be forgotten, and may not remain muted for long," Credit Agricole says.

    Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) regains some of yesterday's heavy losses and rises back above $1,300 after...

    Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) regains some of yesterday's heavy losses and rises back above $1,300 after bargain-hunting Chinese investors enter the market, with the metal increasing 1.2% to $1,301.20 an ounce. However, sentiment remains weak and analysts predict a correction as the U.S. withdraws the stimulus that has supported gold prices for five years. "What the market is undergoing now is a state of normalization," says analyst Joyce Liu. Of other metals, silvers is flat and copper is +0.4%.

    Japanese shares (DXJ) lead the fightback following yesterday's global rout and rise 1.7%, boosted by the weaker yen and an upturn in U.S. stock futures. European equities (FEZ) have are also higher in early trading. "The fall (yesterday) looks overdone because fundamentals are still solid and the U.S. economy seems to be improving," says Allianz's Kazuyuki Terao. Hong Kong -0.5%, China -0.5%, India +0.5%.
